thread.title: DOE Initiatives to Advance Clean Energy Technologies
thread.title_full: DOE Initiatives to Advance Clean Energy Technologies

title: DOE Initiatives to Advance Clean Energy Technologies
text:
08 DOE Initiatives to Advance Clean Energy Technologies 
ACHR News: WASHINGTON â€” The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) announced that its Loan Programs Office (LPO) will make up to $1 billion in loan guarantees available to support commercial-scale distributed energy projects, such as rooftop solar with energy storage and smart grid technology. In addition, through the Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy (ARPA-E), DOE is awarding $24 million in funding for 11 high-performance solar power projects that could lower the cost and improve the performance of solar photovoltaic (PV) power systems.
